Name: Ernst von Weizsäcker
Function: Permanent Secretary of State in the Auswärtiges Amt (Foreign Ministry) under Ribbentrop until 1943, then ambassador to the Holy See; SS-Brigadeführer.
Sentence: 7 years' imprisonment; reduced to 5 years on December 12, 1949, released in October 1950.

Name: Gustav Adolf Steengracht von Moyland
Function: Successor of von Weizsäcker as Secretary of State in the Foreign Ministry (until 1945)
Sentence: 7 years' imprisonment; reduced to 5 years on December 12, 1949, released 1950

Name: Wilhelm Keppler
Function: Secretary of State; Hitler's advisor for economy

Name: Ernst Wilhelm Bohle
Function: NS-Gauleiter, Secretary of State in the Foreign Ministry; head of the Auslandorganisation (foreign organization) of the NSDAP.

Name: Ernst Woermann (de)
Function: Secretary in the Foreign Ministry; head of the political division.
Sentence: 7 years' imprisonment; reduced to 5 years on December 12, 1949; released 1951

Name: Karl Ritter
Function: Liaison between Foreign Office and the High Command of the German armed forces.
Sentence: 4 years' imprisonment incl. time already served; released after the judgment.

Name: Otto von Erdmannsdorff
Function: Secretary in the Foreign Ministry; deputy to Wörmann.

Name: Edmund Veesenmayer
Sentence: 20 years' imprisonment; reduced to 10 years in 1951 and released the same year.

Name: Hans Heinrich Lammers
Sentence: 20 years' imprisonment; reduced to 10 years in January 1951 and released December 16, 1951.

Name: Wilhelm Stuckart
Function: Secretary of State in the Interior Ministry
Sentence: Time already served (3 years and 10 months)
